results.title: Doing the bus stop
results.brief_description: A safety education program using song and dance routines pitched at 8-12 year olds, to demonstrate safe behaviour on and around buses in the country and city. Hale, a “radical” driver, takes Tess on a mystery tour to illustrate vital skills which will ensure the safety of children who use public transport.

results.title: Doing it right the fork lift way
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the do’s and dont’s of fork-lift driving. Illustrates both the correct and incorrect ways of manipulating the vehicle.

results.title: Doing business in Japan
results.creator_credit: Vision Associates and Business Council for International Understanding
results.brief_description: This film deals with the difficulties and complications that arise, in international business relationships, as a result of the cultural barriers that exist. The film is designed to be a teaching/training tool that can be used as the focus of a discussion or course of study.

results.title: Doin' what the crowd does
results.creator_credit: Peter Wallach Enterprises, Scott Newman Foundation, Jane Warrenbrand and Peter Wallach
results.brief_description: This uniquely animated musical film tells us that teenagers don’t necessarily have to follow the crowd, but can think and act for themselves. Exuberant young people dance, sing and perform athletic stunts on a city playground. Within the dance two peer groups interact, one enticing with drugs, alcohol and cigarettes, the other “doing what’s right for me”. The film is open-ended to provoke wide ranging discussion from the audience.

results.title: Dogwatch
results.creator_credit: AFFC, Smile Production, Black Ray Films, Richard Brennan and Laurie McInnes
results.brief_description: From the director of “Broken Highway”, “Dogwatch” is a thriller set at sea aboard a rusty cargo ship with equally as dubious a crew. Captained by alcoholic and corrupt skipper (Steven Vidler) aka ‘The Judas Captain’, the doomed ship is to be sunk by Heckle, the first mate (John Brumpton) once the captain has navigated the vessel to deep waters - all paid for by Triad gangsters. The hapless (sometimes farcical) crew and mysteriously cryptic Palmer (Russell Kiefel) make the journey unbearable for the captain. Stopping off to do a bit of gun smuggling in exchange for gold, the crew discover a stench in the hold and as one crew member points out ‘The Triad’ that organised this cruise won’t be expecting anyone to return. Mutiny and murder take over the minds of the crew as each man tries to assert his will and survive the situation in which they find themselves. Written and directed by Laurie McInnes. Cast includes Richard Carter, Joel Edgerton, John Alansu, Yaw Glymin.

results.title: Dogs, cats and rabbits
results.brief_description: An amusing animated non-narrated film in three parts. Part one: 41 Barks - animated impressions of dogs, drawn and barked by Eliot Noyes Jr. Part two: Catsup - by Lana Hoban with music “Alley cat” by Frank Bjorn, played by Bent Fabric and a cast of five cats Part three: Rabbits, texture, shape and fun with drawings by Bill Stitt. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Dogs in space [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Entertainment Media, Burrowes Film Group, Glenys Rowe and Richard Lowenstein
results.brief_description: A group of young people enjoy the summer of 1979 in the belief that they will never grow up and join the adult world. Action centres on a Melbourne household of punks, hippies, students and radicals who represent the counter culture and the punk generation living on sex, drugs, rock ‘n’ roll and television. Cast includes Michael Hutchence of INXS, Saskia Post, Nique Needles, Chris Haywood, Gary Foley, Joe Camilleri, Noah Taylor.

results.title: Dogs
results.brief_description: Explores the world of dogs and their relationships with humans. Indicates that dog ownership means responsibility and care and that humans can learn a lot about animal behaviour by closely observing their pets. Also shows dogs that herd sheep, help police and blind people and perform tricks.

results.title: Dogs
results.creator_credit: Dimension Films, Michael Murphy and Diane Belle James
results.brief_description: A group of dogs in the countryside and at home. The camera observes in a sensitive and detailed way: as the dogs explore a stream and drink, we see how their tongues work to toss beads of water upwards; the rhythms and sounds, the ways of relating and communicating that are special to dogs. Includes a brief birth sequence.

results.title: Dogpound shuffle
results.brief_description: A tender tale about two lonely wanderers, ex-vaudevillian dancer Steps (Ron Moody) and the drifting Pritt (David Soul) who goes wherever the odd job will take him. Steps is on the road looking for his missing beloved friend, Spot the dancing dog, when he first encounters Pritt. The two strike up a friendship and find themselves in a series of misadventures as they hit the road to find the missing Spot. A story for the family - one with a happy ending.
